This is one of David Gray's oldest song and, im my opinnion, one of his most 
beautiful. It used to be called Lara's Song but then in 1993-94 he shortened it to 
just L's Song. L's Song can be found on The EP's 92-94 record which was released 
in 2001 by David Gray's old record company.

Subject: Tom Petty: Girl On LSD


Tom Petty
Girl on L.S.D.
B-side to the single "You Don't Know How it Feels"
chords figured out by Mark Matthews (rmmatt01@homer.louisvill.edu)
(I think they're right, anyway)

On the album it's played on a clean electric, but this is a great song to
play with an acoustic and a six-pack (or whatever drug you and your girl's
on) with a bunch of friends on the back porch.  But what Petty song isn't,
right?


Note: When you're strumming the D chord do the following slide every now
and then before each verse: xxx23x ----- xxx77X ----- xxx23x (it's hard to
explain in writing, but if you hear the song you'll know what bit I'm
talking about)
